key_channel_insights.line_content: Coverage gap exceeds 56%, with effectively zero parity and under 1% discounted pricing.
Coverage gap near 58%, stable 29% alignment, and minimal above-website fares (<1%).
Over half of flights missing, ~48% priced higher, and under 1% cheaper than direct.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over half of itineraries (around 56%) show no matching offer on the OTA, trending slightly higher than last week.
Pricing identical to the airline’s site is effectively zero, reinforcing a lack of direct parity on this channel.
Fewer than 1% of cases are priced below the airline’s site, staying consistently low across weeks.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Rates hover above 55% and rose 3–4% from the prior week, indicating a widening coverage gap.
Almost nonexistent, with near-zero frequency in all time frames.
Sits around 44% of itineraries last week, with a 1.6–2% average price premium above the airline’s site.
Steady below 1%, offering negligible cost advantage for travelers compared to direct booking.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: 56% of itineraries not matched, and 43% priced higher. The coverage gap continued to grow ~3.7% from last week.
55% not matched, 44% priced higher, with coverage gap rising ~4.4%. No identical pricing reported.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 55.5% unmatched, 44% costlier, and nearly no identical fares. Discounts remain under 0.2%.
58% unmatched and 41% higher. Slightly larger discount share than TR at about 0.8%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 56% coverage gap and 44% higher fares. OTA-lower share reaches 0.4%, yet remains marginal.
57% unmatched and 43% higher. Discounted fares dip to 0.1%, underscoring limited near-term advantage.

mse_highlights.line_content: Over half of flights are not listed on MSE, with MSE N/A at nearly 58% last week—a 3.66% rise from the prior week.
Same fares sit at around 29% last week, slightly declining from last month. This suggests stable parity despite recent dips.
MSE fares exceed the website in less than 1% of itineraries, indicating no significant risk of higher third-party prices.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: MSE N/A rose over 3% from last week and nearly 9% from last month, highlighting a growing portion of flights not listed.
Stands at 29% last week, down from 36% a month ago, suggesting fewer itineraries match the airline's pricing.
Now roughly 13% last week, dipping from 15% last month, with a -0.1% average price difference.
Remains negligible, under 1% of cases, with little variation among the periods analyzed.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: MSE N/A exceeds 58% last week, up from 54%. SAME holds near 30%, while MSE LOWER runs around 12%.
MSE N/A is at 55% last week, rising 6% from the prior week. MSE LOWER sits around 27% but dipped 2% week over week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: MSE N/A leads at nearly 59% last week, up by 3.5% from the prior week. SAME is decreasing; MSE LOWER remains under 5%.
MSE N/A stands at 53% last week, with MSE LOWER also significant at 39%. Both indicate notable coverage differences outside TR.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Coverage gaps near 56%, up 3.6%. SAME dropped from 34% to 32%, while MSE LOWER dipped slightly to 12%.
MSE N/A tops 61%, up nearly 4% from last week and 12% from last month, with fewer identical or lower fares.

gds_highlights.line_content: More than 50% of website fares did not appear in GDS last week, up about 5% vs last month.
Approximately 48% of routes price higher on GDS, though down by ~5% from a month ago.
Fewer than 1% of itineraries are cheaper via GDS, showing limited price advantage.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Now at 51% overall, reflecting a modest rise from last month’s 46%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 51% missing on GDS, 48% higher. Both metrics improved by ~4–5% from last month.
50% missing and 49% higher, signaling a similar downward trend in GDS markups.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Around half of fares not listed, nearly half priced higher, and only 0.24% cheaper via GDS.
Over 53% missing, 44% marked higher, and 2.6% cheaper in GDS.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 51% missing and 48% higher fares, down from last month.
52% not visible, 47% priced higher, with slightly rising cheaper fares (~0.88%).
